titles: Ovid de Ponto Containing foure books of elegies. Written by him in Tomos, a citie of Pontus, in the foure last yeares of his life, and so dyed there in the seaventh yeare of his banishment from Rome. Translated by W.S.
author: Ovid, 43 B.C.-17 or 18 A.D.
Saltonstall, Wye, fl. 1630-1640.
publisher: By T. Cotes, for Michael Sparke Iunior, dwelling at the blue Bible in Greene Arbor,
notes: A translation of: Epistulae ex Ponto.
A reissue of the 1639 edition, with motto on title page replaced by "The second edition" and date changed from 1639 to 1640.
Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
